intro_text: The patrol tracks the scent of a large red lizard along the edge of the Clan's territory.
decline_text: The patrol decides not to pursue such a dangerous creature, especially seeing as it hasn't crossed the border.

success_outcomes.text: The patrol shadows the red lizard, sending a message back to warn camp. It's an exhausting and stressful day, but by the time night falls, they've confirmed that the lizard is leaving the local area, and the patrol has assured c_n's safety.
The patrol gathers their courage and valiantly tries to lead away the red lizard. With such a small group of slugcats, they can only lead it a short distance, but it's better than nothing.
s_c sets up a careful ambush ahead of the red lizard, and {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} surprising, darting attack bloodies the lizard's flank, dissuading it from heading further into c_n territory.

s_c selflessly takes the scavenger's share of the run as the patrol leads the red lizard on, exhausting {PRONOUN/s_c/self} almost to the point of danger but leading the lizard far away from c_n borders. {PRONOUN/s_c/poss/CAP} Clanmates support {PRONOUN/s_c/object} on the long walk home once it's all over, their purrs mixing with s_c's exhausted pants.

s_c spots the huge red lizard first, and stops the rest of the patrol. Instead of brandishing a spear, they use kindness as their weapon... And it somehow works! The red lizard follows s_c home, happily sticking close to their new friend.

r_c spots the huge red lizard first, and stops the rest of the patrol. Instead of brandishing a spear, they use kindness as their weapon... And it somehow works! The red lizard follows r_c home, happily sticking close to their new friend.

fail_outcomes.text: The patrol tries to keep watch over the lizard from a distance, but it spots the slugcats and forces them to scatter. Everyone escapes just fine, but they lose track of the lizard. It could be anywhere - still out there, lurking, waiting to attack.

s_c tries to take the scavenger's share of the effort to lead the red lizard away, but {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} strength fails {PRONOUN/s_c/object} and the rest of the patrol needs to rescue {PRONOUN/s_c/object}, which cuts the patrol short. Everyone knows the lizard could still be lurking on their borders.

The patrol tries to lead the red lizard away from the Clan's borders, but with so few slugcats it's impossible to cover each other's backs. r_c falls to the lizard as the rest of the patrol runs for their lives back to camp, terrified out of their pelts and mourning their Clanmate.

intro_text: The patrol stumbles across a red lizard wandering through the middle of the Clan's territory.
decline_text: The patrol decides not to pursue such a dangerous creature. c_n will just have to hope it doesn't come any nearer to camp.

success_outcomes.text: They decide that no slugcat is going to be surprised by this predator again, and the patrol shadows the lizard, sending a message to warn camp. With enough slugcats to keep watch, rest, track, and send messages back and forth, c_n is kept safe from the wandering lizard.

The patrol gathers their courage and valiantly drives away the red lizard. Together, working as one, and with all the strength of the Ascended behind them, the patrol harries the lizard. By keeping up a series of small skirmishes through the entire day, they drive it all the way off c_n territory.

s_c has just enough time to yowl out a plan, leading the whole large patrol in a skillful battle maneuver against the red lizard that protects the slugcats from the chance of injury. The lizard tucks tail and runs for more friendly lands.

s_c selflessly throws {PRONOUN/s_c/self} into the fight, and every time the red lizard tries to grab at {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} Clanmates, {PRONOUN/s_c/subject}{VERB/s_c/'re/'s} there with a spear, standing to look twice {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} normal size. With s_c defending them, the patrol drives the lizard off, yowling triumphantly.

s_c spots the huge red lizard first, and stops the rest of the patrol. Instead of brandishing a spear, they use kindness as their weapon... And it somehow works! The red lizard follows s_c home, happily sticking close to their new friend.

fail_outcomes.text: The patrol tries to keep watch on the red lizard from a distance, but it spots the slugcats and they have to scatter. It's not as bad as it could've been though; r_c manages to keep track of the lizard's position, and it doesn't come any further into c_n territory.

s_c tries to protect {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} Clanmates, but it gets in the way of the attack. Without everyone committed to driving the red lizard off, the patrol has to fall back, but they do so in good order.

With so many slugcats all working as one, the red lizard started to get beaten back. But just as the tide of the fight seems about to turn, one lucky strike hits r_c, and those vicious jaws take {PRONOUN/r_c/object} to the Void.

intro_text: The patrol stumbles across a pack of yellow lizards wandering through the middle of the Clan's territory.
decline_text: The patrol decides not to pursue such dangerous creaturse. c_n will just have to hope they don't come any nearer to camp.

success_outcomes.text: They decide that no slugcat is going to be surprised by these predators again, and the patrol shadows the lizards, sending a message to warn camp. With enough slugcats to keep watch, rest, track, and send messages back and forth, c_n is kept safe from the wandering lizards.

The patrol gathers their courage and valiantly drives away the yellow lizards. Together, working as one, and with all the strength of the Ascended behind them, the patrol harries the lizards. By keeping up a series of small skirmishes through the entire day, they drive them all the way off c_n territory.

s_c has just enough time to yowl out a plan, leading the whole large patrol in a skillful battle maneuver against the yellow lizards that protects the slugcats from the chance of injury. The lizards tuck tail and run for more friendly lands.

s_c selflessly throws {PRONOUN/s_c/self} into the fight, and every time the yellow lizards try to grab at {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} Clanmates, {PRONOUN/s_c/subject}{VERB/s_c/'re/'s} there, spear brandished, standing to look twice {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} normal size. With s_c defending them, the patrol drives the lizards off, yowling triumphantly.

r_c spots the pack of yellow lizards first, and stops the rest of the patrol. One of the beasts, lingering further away from the pack, is approached with kindness... After a little persuation, it follows r_c home, leaving it's pack behind.

s_c spots the pack of yellow lizards first. One of the beasts, lingering further away from the pack, is approached with kindness... After a little persuation, it follows s_c home, leaving it's pack behind.

s_c spots the pack of yellow lizards first, and stops the rest of the patrol. Carefully, prey is offered to the pack... The gift is accepted! Soon, the lizards choose their favorite scugs and follow them home.

r_c spots the pack of yellow lizards first, and stops the rest of the patrol. Carefully, prey is offered to the pack... The gift is accepted! Soon, the lizards choose their favorite scugs and follow them home.

fail_outcomes.text: The patrol tries to keep watch on the yellow lizard pack from a distance, but they spots the slugcats and they have to scatter. It's not as bad as it could've been though; r_c manages to keep track of the pack's position, and it doesn't come any further into c_n territory.

s_c tries to protect {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} Clanmates, but it gets in the way of the attack. Without everyone committed to driving the lizard pack off, the patrol has to fall back, but they do so in good order.

With so many slugcats all working as one, the yellow lizards start to get beaten back. But just as the tide of the fight seems about to turn, one lucky strike hits r_c, and those vicious jaws take {PRONOUN/r_c/object} to the Void.

intro_text: The patrol comes across a pink lizard.
decline_text: The patrol decides not to pursue the lizard.

success_outcomes.text: r_c hisses at the pink lizard, warning it off. It skitters back, hissing loudly but headed in the right direction. Maybe {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} should add lizard herding to {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} list of accomplishments?
r_c unsheathes {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} spear, standing as tall as {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} can, gathers {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} courage, and drives the pink lizard from the border.
s_c unleashes all {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} battle experience, darting this way and that, slicing chunks of lizard hide as {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/drive/drives} it into the distance.

s_c spots the pink lizard first, and pauses. Instead of brandishing a spear, they use kindness as their weapon... And it somehow works! The pink lizard follows s_c home, happily sticking close to their new friend.

r_c spots the pink lizard first, and pauses. Instead of brandishing a spear, they use kindness as their weapon... And it somehow works! The pink lizard follows r_c home, happily sticking close to their new friend.

fail_outcomes.text: All r_c's attempts to drive the pink lizard off only send it into greater and greater fits of excitement until the only thing to do is wait, miserable and humiliated, in a safe spot for the beast to calm down.

The animal is far more tenacious than r_c ever expected, and once the fight starts, there's no escaping from it. As r_c's world goes dark, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/have/has} {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} fangs sunk in the pink lizard's throat. At least {PRONOUN/r_c/subject}'ll take the beast with {PRONOUN/r_c/object}.

intro_text: The patrol comes across a pink lizard right on the border of c_n territory.
decline_text: p_l decides not to pursue the lizard and instead cuts the patrol short to head back to camp and report it.

success_outcomes.text: p_l hisses at the pink lizard, and the rest of {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} small team {VERB/p_l/back/backs} {PRONOUN/p_l/object} up. The lizard skitters back, hissing loudly, apparently shocked by the display. The patrol breaks out into yowls and caterwauls until the lizard loses its nerve and runs from the c_n border into the distance.

The patrol paces towards the pink lizard, spear out, standing tall, backed up with the courage of their Clanmates. The lizard breaks into a hissing fit, but that's their opportunity to attack, covering each other as they push the creature away from their territory.

s_c calls out a battle plan, and the slugcats flow into it, carefully covering each other and driving the pink lizard backwards until it loses its nerve, tucks tail, and runs from c_n territory, deep into the wilderness.

s_c spots the pink lizard first, and stops the rest of the patrol. Instead of brandishing a spear, they use kindness as their weapon... And it somehow works! The pink lizard follows s_c home, happily sticking close to their new friend.
